wikipedia_page.main:
Norman Sharp (15 April 1901 – 14 July 1977) was an English cricketer who made one appearance in first-class cricket in 1923. He played as a right-handed batsman.
Sharp made his only appearance in first-class cricket when he was selected to play for Warwickshire against Worcestershire in the County Championship at Edgbaston. He batted just once in the match, which Warwickshire won by 7 wickets, scoring 3 runs from the lower-order, before being dismissed bowled by Leslie Gale.He died at Sutton Coldfield, Warwickshire on 14 July 1977.
